caption.p: Uses of seroepidemiology in immunization programs

tr.td: 1. Cross-sectional surveys to determine the need for immunization programs in:
School/college entry—identify omissions, failures, loss of protective antibody
2. Follow-up measurements in immunized persons to determine:
(a) Proportion developing local, humoral, cell-mediated immune responses
(c) Nature and degree of interaction between vaccine components
(e) Level of protection against disease and asymptomatic infection
(f) Degree of spread of live vaccine strains to exposed and susceptible contacts
3. Periodic serological surveillance to identify groups who are not receiving vaccines or who have inadequate responses
